xml.section: Genome: Browse the C. elegans and other genomes with the Generic Genome Browser, a part of the Generic Model Organism Database (GMOD) project.
BLAST/BLAT: Search for a sequence in protein, genomic DNA and EST databases. NOTE: A new user interface has been released.

WormMart: A data mining resource that provides easy and interactive access to data en masse. In particular, WormMart enables users to retrieve sequences and genome annotations using a variety of filters to constrain retrieved results. NOTE: An improved user interface has been released.

Markers: This page is designed to assist in the selection of SNPS and visible genetic markers for mapping experiments. Provided with a genetic interval, it will display all visible markers and SNPs within that interval, as well as strains carrying those SNPs
Batch Sequences: A batch sequence dumper that allows you to export sequences with various types of filters.
Genetic Maps: Examine chromosomes and genetic intervals with this ACeDB-style genetic map viewer.

Submit data to Wormbase: We offer multiple submission options and can also provide assistance in formatting and processing for easy incorporation into WormBase. By submitting your data to WormBase, you help to ensure its long-term availability as well as place it within a rich, highly cross-referenced context.

Click this link for more information.

Searches A portal to the various types of simple and complex searches that can be done in WormBase.

Look here if you are interested in bulk data, data mining and more sophisticated WormBase queries.
Literature Search: Perform a detailed search of C. elegans papers and abstracts with Textpresso.

Results as XML: For power users/data miners. This option will dump the data directly from the acedb database object in XML format.
You may also wish to consider using WormMart.

Wormbase Suggest: Based on what you type, wormbase does a quick database search and suggests optimized queries.
  • You can ignore the suggestions.
  • To choose a selection, use your mouse or arrow down and hit 'enter'.
  • Uncheck this box to disable autocompletion.

Exact match: Selecting this option will force the database search to consider only results that exactly match the query phrase. For example, an exact search would look for 'pharyngeal gland cell' vs. 'pharyngeal', 'gland' and/or 'cell'.
